column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Four more Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Thursday.Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 819 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Thursday
column5: 933 on Wednesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.As of Thursday
column7: the number of positive cases confirmed in the past seven days was 12
column9: there were 338 patients with Covid-19 in hospitals in Northern Ireland
column10: up from 329 on Wednesday.There were also 38 patients with Covid-19 in hospital intensive care units
column11: unchanged since Wednesday.Last updated 9 December at 14:15 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 3
column13: 599 vaccines for Covid-19 had been administered in Northern Ireland as of Thursday.Of those
column16: 138 of the jabs were first doses
column20: 801 were third doses.The remainder were booster jabs.Last updated 9 December at 14:20 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandThe total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
